pr_title: DB-9109 fix problems with parallel runs of tests all writing to xxx/target/external

timeline.message:
DB-9109 fix problems with parallel runs of tests all writing to xxx/target/external

every test that needs a temporary output dir will now on-demand create a temp directory,
that will be deleted automatically after the test has run, using the @After annotation of JUnit.

timeline.bodyText: I think "null_test_location_avro" should be "/null_test_location_avro", otherwise, the temporary directory used would be something like "SpliceUnitTest_temp_xxxxnull_test_location_avro" instead of "SpliceUnitTest_temp_xxxxn/ull_test_location_avro". And the after test call deleteTempDirectory() wouldn't be able to delete this directory.  Everything else looks good to me.
timeline.author: yxia92

replies.bodyText: actually a lot of tests forgot the /, so i added it to getTempOutputDirectory
replies.author: martinrupp

timeline.bodyText: Better create temp directories in "/target" as previously - build is self-contained, more control, less surprises.
timeline.author: OlegMazurov

timeline.bodyText:
Why not merge the content of this class into SpliceUnitTest. We already have createBadLogDirectory there, f.e.
Developers creating new unit tests won't need to differentiate between SpliceUnitTest and SpliceUnitTestWithTempDirectory: either you use the temporary directory or not. Passive overhead is negligible.
